title: Days out with Skiddle : The best experiences and attractions in the united kingdom
body_text:
Here are the best events and attractions on Skiddle.
Skiddle Staff
Date published: 28th Feb 2024
We hope you're looking forward to the summer because we have a reminder here of what's going to make this one so great, the Euro's. Yep, we have a live screening of England's first game available to book your place at now, where you can imagine the good vibes. Add to this live theatre, charity fundraisers and a tattoo convention and we've got something for everyone.
When: Friday 26th April 2024
Where: Cumbernauld New Town Hall, Cumbernauld
Scottish comedian, writer and actress Karen Dunbar will be touring all across Scotland this year, and she'll be coming to Cumbernauld to bring her unique sense of humour to stage. You may know her for her role on Chewin' the Fat and the array of hilarious characters she played.
Buy tickets:
When: Saturday 6th - Sunday 7th July
Where: Ashton Gate Stadium, Bristol
Bristol Tattoo Convention returns for 2024, taking place at Ashton Gate Stadium, where a wide range of artists will be on show. Browse a diverse amount of styles and see if you can be inspired for your next tattoo. Get one done on the day or learn more about the trade.
Buy tickets:
When: Saturday 25th May
Where: Islay Whisky Vault, Isle of Islay
For fans of all things whisky, this will be your lucky day as you're invited into the vault at Islay whisky, where they will be launching bottles of their specially selected cask for Feis Isle 2024. The Â£10 entry will get you in as well as a tasting glass, lanyard, welcome dram and three people will have the chance to win a bottle of the new cask.
Buy tickets:
Mill Green - Easter Golf Night
When: Friday 29th March
Where: The Club at Mill Green in Hatfield
Hop on over to Mill Green to experience some Easter-themed night golf. Let the fun begin underneath the stars, where you'll get to play seven holes on a par three course, Afterwards, you'll be treated to a delicious meal too, on what promises to be a memorable night.
Buy tickets:
An Afternoon With Leeds United's Ian Harte
When: Sunday 9th June
Where: Scholars Bar, Scarborough
A chance to be in the room with a Leeds United legend, this event is put on by the Scarborough branch of the supporters club. Ian Harte will be in conversation, with one of hist most notable achievements being a part of the memorable Leeds team who progressed to the Champions League semi-finals in the 2000-2001 season.
Buy tickets:
England vs Serbia Euros Group Game 1
When: Sunday 16th June
Where: Apps Court Farm, Walton-On-Thames
It isn't too long to go now until the Euro's. We can already see the sun being out in force, with pints and plenty of football to be watched. There's optimism about England's chances going into the tournament with world-class talents such as Bellingham and Kane surely ready to take us far. You can see how they get on in their first game against Serbia at this screening event.
Buy tickets:
Liverpool v Wolves - Jurgen's Farewell
When: Sunday 19th May
Where: The Dome at Grand Central Hall, Liverpool
Jurgen announced last month that this would be his last season as manager of Liverpool. His last game with the club could potentially be the season closer against Wolves. Here, you can watch the game and get fully immersed in what will be an emotional goodbye for a Liverpool legend.
Buy tickets:
When: Tuesday 18th June - Friday 13th September
Where: Wyndham's Theatre, London
Next To Normal is a story that focusses on themes of family, illness, loss and grief. We follow Diana Goodman, a wife and mother living with Bipolar disorder and haunted by her past. There will be plenty of memorable moments as this is a musical that tackles difficult themes but will leave you with the joy of some amazing songs.
Find tickets for Next To Normal - here
North Leeds Charity Beer Festival 2024
When: Friday 12th April
Where: North Leeds Cricket Club, Leeds
The Rotary Club of Roundhay are putting on their annual large fundraiser. A charity beer festival which will see 36 hand-picked locally-brewed ales for you to try, with food being served and live music being played to make this a proper day out. All proceeds will be going to Rotary charities, with 72k raised since their beginnings in 2012.
